issues.shortMessage: Refactor the code to not rely on potentially unsafe array conversions.
issues.fullMessage: Array covariance is the principle that if an implicit or explicit reference conversion exits from type "A" to "B", then the same conversion exists from the array type "A[]" to "B[]". While this array conversion can be useful in readonly situations to pass instances of "A[]" wherever "B[]" is expected, it must be used with care, since assigning an instance of "B" into an array of "A" will cause an "ArrayTypeMismatchException" to be thrown at runtime.

properties.title: Array covariance should not be used
